message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

The paper presents a method for real-time 3D human pose estimation using a single RGB camera, which involves computer vision (CV) techniques such as convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and kinematic skeleton fitting. Therefore, cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) is the most likely sub-category. The method also involves robotics (RO) as it can be used for 3D character control. The use of CNNs suggests that the paper may also belong to the sub-categories of machine learning (LG) and artificial intelligence (AI). Finally, the paper may also be relevant to graphics (GR) as it involves 3D pose reconstruction.
